articles.headline: Obama Confronts Americans’ Fears in State of the Union Speech
articles.snippet: In his final State of the Union message, the president urged Americans to confront the challenges of the future by rejecting fear and embracing change.
articles.abstract: In his final State of the Union message, the president urged Americans to confront the challenges of the future by rejecting fear and embracing change.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama on Tuesday set forth an ambitious vision for America’s future but conceded his own failure to heal the political divisions holding back progress, calling it a lasting disappointment of his tenure.
articles.byline: By Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Michael D. Shear

articles.headline: Republican Candidates Grapple With a Touchy Topic: Poverty
articles.snippet: With the primaries bearing down, six presidential hopefuls ponder how to cut government without further harming the poor and helpless.
articles.abstract: With the primaries bearing down, six presidential hopefuls ponder how to cut government without further harming the poor and helpless.
articles.lead_paragraph: COLUMBIA, S.C. — On Saturday, only three weeks before voters in Iowa first get to weigh in on the presidential candidates, six Republican hopefuls gathered at a convention center here to talk about poverty. Donald Trump and Ted Cruz, the top two, weren’t there. But still, poverty?

articles.headline: ‘Bellwether’ G.M. Trial Opens Over Defect Claim
articles.snippet: In a federal courtroom in Manhattan, General Motors raised questions about the story of a man who was injured in a 2014 accident in Oklahoma.
articles.abstract: In a federal courtroom in Manhattan, General Motors raised questions about the story of a man who was injured in a 2014 accident in Oklahoma.
articles.lead_paragraph: While acknowledging its role in failing to report a deadly defect for more than a decade, General Motors on Tuesday forcefully questioned the story of a man who was injured in a May 2014 crash and is suing the company.

articles.headline: Iran Seizes U.S. Sailors Amid Claims of Spying
articles.snippet: American officials said that the military had lost contact with the boats in the Persian Gulf and that Iran had promised to return the sailors soon.
articles.abstract: American officials said that the military had lost contact with the boats in the Persian Gulf and that Iran had promised to return the sailors soon.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Iran seized two United States Navy patrol boats and 10 crew members who were described as “trespassing” on Tuesday in Iranian waters near a major naval base.
articles.byline: By Helene Cooper and David E. Sanger

articles.headline: New Corporate Raider Enters Picture, With Eye on a Sale of Ally
articles.snippet: The hedge fund Lion Point Capital has proposed two candidates for the board of Ally Financial and urged the company to explore strategic alternatives.
articles.abstract: The hedge fund Lion Point Capital has proposed two candidates for the board of Ally Financial and urged the company to explore strategic alternatives.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the financier Saul P. Steinberg tried to take over Chemical Bank in 1969, he drew the ire of the governor of New York.
articles.byline: By Michael Corkery and Leslie Picker

articles.headline: Supreme Court to Hear Case Involving Judgments Against Iran
articles.snippet: The Supreme Court will consider whether Congress acted constitutionally in passing a 2012 law that helps families of victims of terrorist attacks collect judgments against Iran.
articles.abstract: The Supreme Court will consider whether Congress acted constitutionally in passing a 2012 law that helps families of victims of terrorist attacks collect judgments against Iran.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Iranian government has come under sharp criticism for not giving imprisoned Americans a fair and public court hearing. But on Wednesday at the Supreme Court, Iran will get just that.

articles.headline: State of the Union Speech Is One Half of Nation’s Political Split Screen
articles.snippet: As he begins his final stretch, President Obama has been trying to counter the glass-is-half-empty view coming from so many candidates intent on succeeding him.
articles.abstract: As he begins his final stretch, President Obama has been trying to counter the glass-is-half-empty view coming from so many candidates intent on succeeding him.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Over the course of 48 hours, Americans will confront two starkly disparate views of Barack Obama’s America that will frame the debate over the future of the country in this election year and beyond.

articles.headline: Sexual Attacks Widen Divisions in European Migrant Crisis
articles.snippet: Anti-immigration groups and right-wing extremists have seized on a wave of assaults in Cologne, Germany, on New Year’s Eve to discredit all migrants as criminals or hooligans.
articles.abstract: Anti-immigration groups and right-wing extremists have seized on a wave of assaults in Cologne, Germany, on New Year’s Eve to discredit all migrants as criminals or hooligans.
articles.lead_paragraph: ROME — In Finland, militia groups are patrolling small towns housing asylum seekers in the name of protecting white Finnish women. In Germany, far-right protesters rampaged through Leipzig on Monday, vandalizing buildings in an “anti-Islamization” demonstration. In Italy on Tuesday, an anti-immigration regional government approved the text of a law making it difficult to construct new mosques as Muslim refugees are settled in the area.

articles.headline: Iran’s Swift Release of U.S. Sailors Hailed as a Sign of Warmer Relations
articles.snippet: It remained unclear who decided to release the sailors or how their two patrol boats ended up in Iranian territorial waters.
articles.abstract: It remained unclear who decided to release the sailors or how their two patrol boats ended up in Iranian territorial waters.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A crisis over the seizing of two American patrol boats in the Persian Gulf was averted Wednesday when Iran returned the craft and released their crews as Pentagon officials struggled to explain how the boats had ended up near a major Iranian naval base.
articles.byline: By David E. Sanger, Eric Schmitt and Helene Cooper

articles.headline: Why Media Titans Would Be Wise Not to Overlook Netflix
articles.snippet: Although Netflix’s strategy is not without a fair amount of risk, it just keeps working — and the company’s prospects are steadily brightening.
articles.abstract: Although Netflix’s strategy is not without a fair amount of risk, it just keeps working — and the company’s prospects are steadily brightening.
articles.lead_paragraph: Imagine you run a global media conglomerate. Say you’re Robert A. Iger, the chief executive of Disney, or Brian L. Roberts, of Comcast, or perhaps you’re slightly lower down on the ladder of behemoths — the boss of Twenty-First Century Fox or Time Warner, perhaps. In any case, you own a lot of valuable stuff: movie studios, broadcast and cable TV networks, perhaps a broadband infrastructure, maybe some theme parks with roller coasters and a few impressive castles.
